greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest sequence such that for all i, j, a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j), where f(n) = A323244(n) for n > 1, and f(1) = -1.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of function f, defined as f(1) = -1, and for n > 1, f(n) = A033879(A156552(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4096
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 10 2019
